Present location: BIBLIOTHECA ALEXANDRINA ANTIQUETIES MUSEUM [01/027] ALEXANDRIA BAAM
Name: Amphora with long neck
Description: This elongated vessel has a long neck and a conical body with a pointed base. The mouth is narrow, and the amphora is provided with two handles that start near the mouth and stop on the shoulder. Vessels of this kind were hung up by means of ropes attached to the handles. They were made to contain liquids such as wine.
